manipulation.image

Class ImageEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • manipulation.image.ImageEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Encoder

    public class ImageEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Encoder

    This class is used to encode and decode a hidden message within a image media file.

      • encode_JPEG

        public static byte[] encode_JPEG(byte[] fileArray,
                                 byte[] message,
                                 int bitsPerByteForEncoding,
                                 java.lang.String passwordKey)
                          throws java.lang.Exception

        Encodes a given string message within a given JPEG covertext, hiding the message within the compressed scan data (as detailed in JPEGCodec})

        Parameters:
        fileArray - the JPEG file covertext in byte array format
        message - the byte array message which is to be hidden within the given covertext.
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per byte of the image data which will be used to hide the message.
        passwordKey - the string key which will be used as the encryption cipher's key
        Returns:
        a byte array of the image data, altered to contain the message
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • encode_msg

        public byte[] encode_msg(WorkFile file,
                         byte[] message,
                         short bitsPerByteForEncoding,
                         java.lang.String passwordKey)
                  throws MessageTooLargeException

        Encodes a given string message within a given BufferedImage covertext using Least Significant Bit embedding.

        The embedding process is as follows:

        (1) The message byte array is joined to the end of the message-length byte array, forming an byte array containing the message-length, and the message.

        (2) This array is embedding into the image data using the BPB(Bits Per Byte value)

        (3) All of the LSB data from the image is extracted into a single byte array, forming an array of all the LSB data which fits within the Encryption cipher algorithm's block size. This means the array's size will be the length of the image data array, rounded down to the lowest multiple of 16, minus 16 - the minus 16 required due to the padding scheme adding an extra block is the data is full.

        (4) This LSB data is encrypted using the Encryption Cipher, using a hashed version of the supplied string key.

        (5) This, now encrypted LSB data, is reinserted back into the image data LSB

        Citation (embedding process follows the principles of):
        http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/27950-steganography/

        Specified by:
        encode_msg in interface Encoder
        Parameters:
        file - the covertext which is used to hide the given message.
        message - the byte array message which is to be hidden within the given covertext.
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per byte of the image data which will be used to hide the message.
        passwordKey - the string key which will be used as the encryption cipher's key
        Returns:
        a byte array of the image data, altered to contain the message
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException - if the message is too large to be hidden in the given covertext.
        MessageTooLargeException

      • decode_msg

        public byte[] decode_msg(WorkFile file,
                         java.lang.String passwordKey)
                  throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                         java.lang.Exception

        Decodes a hidden message from a given BufferedImage stegotext, reversing the technique used in the encoding process.

        The recovery process is as follows:

        (1) The LSB data is recovered from the image data to form a single byte array containing the LSB data.

        (2) - The supplied string password is used to get it's hashed equivalent. This hashed key is then used by the encryption cipher to get the plaintext LSB data.

        (3) - The message length value is extracted from the LSB data, using the first 4 bytes to form an integer, which informs how long the message is (in bytes).

        (4) - Using the recovered message length, the algorithm nows how many elements of the LSB data are part of the message, thus it recovers the relevant bytes, which are returned.

        Specified by:
        decode_msg in interface Encoder
        Parameters:
        file - the WorkFile stegotext which contains the hidden message.
        passwordKey - the string key which will be used as the encryption cipher's key
        Returns:
        the byte array message recovered from the stegotext.
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.lang.Exception

      • encode_msg

        @Deprecated
public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage encode_msg(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                                   java.lang.String message,
                                                                   short bitsPerByteForEncoding,
                                                                   EncodeController e)
                                                            throws MessageTooLargeException
        Deprecated. 

        Encodes a given string message within a given BufferedImage covertext using Least Significant Bit embedding.

        The BufferedImage, message and the message length are first converted into byte arrays, which allow for the manipulation to insert the hidden message.

        Before the message itself is encoded into the image file, the amount of bits per image byte being used to encode the message, is encoded into the image first (using 1bit lsb embedding). After that, the length of the message (in bytes) is added to the image, this allows for the decoder to be able to know where the message lies in the image. This length, being an integer value, takes from up from 4 to 32 bytes of the image bytes based upon the bits per image byte setting.

        Once the length has been encoded, the message itself is encoded within the image. Similarly to the message length encoded before, the message's bytes are encoded using the least significant bits in each byte of image data, requiring from 1 to 8 bytes of image data per byte of message.

        Citation (encoding process follows the principles of):
        http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/27950-steganography/

        Parameters:
        image - the covertext which is used to hide the given message.
        message - the String message which is to be hidden within the given covertext.
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per byte of the image data which will be used to hide the message.
        e - the EncodeController of which this method is called from (used for callbacks to update the encoding progress)
        Returns:
        the BufferedImage stegotext containing the hidden message
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException - if the message is too large to be hidden in the given covertext.
        MessageTooLargeException

      • decode_msg

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String decode_msg(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                       DecodeController d)
        Deprecated. 

        Decodes a hidden message from a given BufferedImage stegotext, using the same Least Significant Bits technique used to encode the image.

        Firstly, the the amount of bits per image byte data is decoded from the image, which is embedded in the first 4 bytes of data.

        Next, the length of the hidden message is decoded from the given image via extracting the first 1 to 4 bytes worth of LSB's from the image data and constructing an integer from this data.

        The length value is used to know how much of the image data contains the hidden message, which allows the decoder to form a string from the extracted data without misinterpreting bit values which have nothing to do with the message.

        Parameters:
        image - the BufferedImage stegotext which contains the hidden message.
        Returns:
        the String message decoded from the stegotext.

      • getMaxMessageSize

        public static long getMaxMessageSize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                     int bitsPerByteForEncoding)

        Used to calculate how much space (in bytes) a given image stegotext has for hiding message bits. The bytes available for the message equal to: (((total_image_bytes - bits_per_byte_bytes) * bits_per_byte) / 8) - message_length_bytes

        Parameters:
        image - the covertext image
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per stegotext byte allocated for encoding
        Returns:
        the amount of space available for a hidden message in the covertext

      • getMaxMessageSize

        public static long getMaxMessageSize(WorkFile image,
                                     short bitsPerByteForEncoding)
                              throws java.lang.Exception

        Gets the maximum message size of a given Image workfile

        Parameters:
        image - the workfile containing the file
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the degradation value applied to the file
        Returns:
        long value indicate the maximum message size supported
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
